title.narrative: 2.3: ADOLESCENT DEVELOPMENT AND PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: Learners/young people are afforded opportunities for effective learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability in safe and inclusive environments, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized, are provided with inclusive and equitable quality education, developmental and learning opportunities in safe and secure learning environments

related-activity.ref: 3930/A0/04/802 OUTCOME2: BASIC EDU AND ADOLESCENT DEV.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Learners/young people are afforded opportunities for effective learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/oremployability in safe and inclusive environments

description.narrative: School-Related Gender-Based Violence (SRGBV) is addressed through upstream policy development and downstream capacity building of key personnel. (1) Skills building and empowerment of girls in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) field and (2) enhancing youth leadership through sport further afforded young people opportunities for effective learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and employability in safe/inclusive environments. UNICEF played a critical role both in policy development and rolling out of the key interventions. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2020
